author: vikings
title: He Who Shall Not be Named
review:
Box/Instruction:

Comes in normal CMS bag with normal CMS instructions. 

Parts:

Besides the minifigure parts you get the snake, a white wand and of course the minifigure stand. 

Minifigure:

Lord Voldemort:

Lord Voldemort is only three-piece minifigure. He has a white head with a neutral expression on it. The detail around his eyes of the pinkish color is really cool. The detail on his head in general is well done. The torso and legs are of his dark green robes. You get the new dress legs for his robes instead of straight up legs. Overall it is a very simple figure.  

Overall Opinion: 

Overall I wish they would have done a better job with this figure. Just some detail on the arms or the side of the legs would have been fine. It just feels to simple for a CMS figure. Other than it is a good figure. Getting Lord Voldemort is a worth it alone. Getting Nagini (the snake) is very cool as it is an important part of story. Overall this isn't a bad figure and recommend getting it. Overall I'm giving it a 4-star rating.

author: Odeinoichus
title: They Dare Not Speak his Name.
review:
Set #71022 Lord Voldemort: The evil Dark Wizard arrives in thick dark green robes, he is using a new sloped element which has a noticeable train for the robes in back rather than the straight-backed sloping of past LEGO sloped bricks. Minimal printing is visible for the cut of the robe on the front, he has no detailing on his back.

Carrying his wand and looking suitably sinister, our friend Voldemort is highly dangerous. Cunning and ready to attack. A new animal is included to represent Nagini, she is made of a slightly softer type of plastic and feels very light. Her tail features a bar section allowing a Minifigure to grab onto it. although carrying a snake around like that looks decidedly odd. The eyes are very nicely detailed.

Overall a very impressive variant of the Dark Lord and worth acquiring for Nagini alone. Highly Recommended.
